author: MaximoTrinidad
body:
<!--

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:
- Windows PowerShell [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell)

If it is a bug report:
- make sure you are able to repro it on the latest released version. 
You can install the latest version from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/KNOWNISSUES.md).
- Fill out the following repro template:

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->
First, Congrats in accomplishing the RC milestone on PowerShell Core.

Now, the following link: https://aka.ms/pscore6-docs has good intention. But, the first thing I'm reading reflect Windows PowerShell which will "continue" to cause GREAT Confusion.

Also, looking further deep on the Documentation navigation, talks more about Windows PowerShell features: 
1. Get-WMIObject - which (I think) is not use in PowerShell Core.
2. Web Access for PowerShell - This is a Windows PowerShell feature. Please unless I'm wrong!
3. Windows PowerShell ISE  - In this case, should it be replace  to VS Code Editor??

This is just a few items. I'm hoping when the GA becomes available the documentation could be corrected.

Thanks and Great Work!!

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
PS C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6.0.0-rc> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.0.0-rc
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-rc
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.17040
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0

PS C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6.0.0-rc>
```

comments.author: bergmeister
comments.body: @MaximoTrinidad I think this issue should rather be opened in the [PowerShell-Docs](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell-Docs) repo.

comments.author: MaximoTrinidad
MaximoTrinidad
comments.body:
@bergmeister, It's done!
6.0.0-rc - Documentation link need to reflect PowerShell Core material. https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell-Docs/issues/1871

comments.author: bergmeister
comments.body: @MaximoTrinidad Linking to other issues using the hash does not work across repos. The correct link to the new issue is [here](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell-Docs/issues/1871). You also might want to consider closing the issue here then.

comments.author: MaximoTrinidad
comments.body:
Thanks again! I'm closing this one,
👍

title: 6.0.0-rc - Documentation link need to reflect PowerShell Core material.
